title: Janela (Ribeira da)
body: It is the longest and most abundant watercourse in Madeira. It originates in Paul da Serra and, crossing the parish that bears the same name, flows into the ocean. A short distance from its mouth, there is an islet that also bears the same name. The well-known levadas of Raba√ßal are largely fed by the springs of this stream, captured at its source. See Ribeira da Janela (Parish of).
